title: Rapid Calibration of an Intracortical Brain-Computer Interface for People with Tetraplegia
abstract: This study explores how quickly individuals with tetraplegia can calibrate intracortical BCI decoders to achieve effective neural control. Using both a steady-state Kalman filter and a novel Gaussian process regression decoder (GP-DKF), the researchers found that three participants rapidly attained closed-loop neural cursor control, with peak performance reached in under 3 minutes. Notably, a BCI-na√Øve user successfully achieved target acquisition only 37 seconds after calibration started, demonstrating the potential for immediate BCI usability without extensive training.
